content:
An **enhanced for loop** loops through the entirety of an array or `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea).

## Components of an Enhanced for Loop

```
for (int value : scores)
```

An enhanced for loop consists of two parts:
- Declaring an enhanced for loop variable `value`(#e7e8ea). The enhanced for loop variable must be the same data type as the elements in the 1D array it is traversing.
- The name of the 1D array to traverse `scores`(#e7e8ea)

## When to Use Enhanced for Loops

Use when:
- Looping through all values in an array or `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea) without changing their values. 
- Looping through all values in an array or `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea)  in order starting at index 0. 

Do not use when:
- You need the index of an element.
- You need to change the values in an array or `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea) .
- You want to loop through only part of an array or `ArrayList`(#e7e8ea)  or in a different order.
